1368319534919221249.text: In the #AmericanRescuePlan, I fought for $1 billion to bolster @AmeriCorps’ engagement on COVID-19 — from tutoring students to combat learning loss to expanding capacity at food banks and handling logistics at vaccination centers.

1368286220044877829.text: With too many students falling behind because of distance learning, I am proud that this package also includes funding to help schools reopen safely for in-person learning and to meet students’ needs.

1368285745513959426.text: To reach the other side of this pandemic, we must get vaccines into the arms of more Americans. The American Rescue Plan includes $20 billion for vaccine distribution and $50 billion for testing and contact tracing so we can contain the virus as quickly as possible.

1368285621282865157.text: It will also deliver needed relief to businesses & nonprofits struggling to stay afloat, including efforts I helped lead to provide $25 billion for restaurants in DE & across the country and to support a small business lending program, which has already helped ~110 DE businesses.

1368281712271241217.text: The #AmericanRescuePlan is what Delaware and our country need at this moment. And with unemployment set to expire in days, we have no time to waste. This bill will extend enhanced unemployment benefits and send $1,400 checks to Americans.

1278409309743955973.text:
Today, when rent is due, millions of Americans who have lost their jobs, had hours cut, gotten sick, or had loved ones get sick may not be able to make their payment, and they could face eviction. 

This is a crisis for all of us, but it impacts communities of color most. https://t.co/SDQwwRj43u

1278406898086301705.text: According to the COVID-19 Eviction Defense Fund, between 19-23 million renters are at risk of evictions by September 30.

1278404772660469763.text: @DerrickNAACP @NAACP @dianeyentel @NLIHC @just_shelter @evictionlab @MyHomeMatters @urbaninstitute Congress has taken some steps to help, but not enough. We passed a federal temporary ban on evictions in the last relief bill, but it only applies to a small set of families and is set to expire on 7/24. Worse, more than half of the country has no statewide eviction ban in place.

1278400981663805440.text: This morning, I had an important, challenging conversation with @DerrickNAACP from the @NAACP, @dianeyentel from the @NLIHC, @just_shelter from the @evictionlab, and @MyHomeMatters from the @urbaninstitute about the steps we need to take to address the housing crisis.

1278392322846330881.text:
In addition to decades of bad policies that have made it harder for families of color to own a home and build wealth, we’re now facing a crisis for families who rent: 

17% of renters couldn’t pay their June rent, and 32% likely can’t pay this month’s rent.

1278384811250454529.text: We’ve seen data that shows us that these housing figures are worsening disproportionately for communities of color during the pandemic.

1278384587371094019.text: Before COVID-19 hit, affordable and fair housing was already a problem. Nearly 11 million households paid more than half of their incomes towards housing and Black and LatinX homeownership rates were 30 percent lower than those of white families.

1278381423913775106.text:
As a country, we’ve been having important, long overdue discussions about systemic racism, and one of the areas where persistent racial inequality exists is in HOUSING. 

It’s a crisis for Black and brown communities – and it’s getting a LOT worse during this pandemic.
